item.title: Report E-2024120507
item.description:
Report E-2024120507

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-30
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 30, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. FCE utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the surfaces and collected all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-28
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, INTERCEPTION OF TWO AIR PACKAGES WAS MADE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED TWO LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS, 38.5 WH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN CALIFORNIA, USA IS 1ZH9199D1203548932. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGES WERE FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MIA TO SDF.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a packaging defect that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 85-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer and dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS (Nick Fletcher - Service Center Mgr. was advised the terminal wants to clean it themselves). The released product and damaged bag will be placed into a 5-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

THE RESPONDER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST DECONTAMINATED THE EQUIPMENT. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE UNDECLARED.

  • Description: XPO in Glenpool, OK contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 300-gallon plastic tote containing IMAGE NO. 186 (Nitric Acid). A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-CUPS of released product onto the wooden trailer in floor and the top of the tote itself in a 2'x2' area. The cap to the tote was defective causing the spill. The contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and replaced the broken cap. One drum of waste was generated containing the impacted and neutralized PPE and absorbents. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report X-2024121334

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM DORAL, FL AND DESTINED FOR HUNTINGTON BEACH, CA WAS DISCOVERED ON 26-DEC-2024 TO BE EXPERIENCING A BATTERY THERMAL EVENT IN A TRAILER AT 2925 E JURUPA STREET IN ONTARIO, CA 91761. THE DISCOVERY OCCURRED DUE TO VISIBLE SMOKE WITHIN THE TRAILER. THE FIRE SELF-EXTINGUISHED, AND BURNED A HOLE IN THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, IT WAS DISCOVERED (3) LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS WERE IN THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE POSSESSED NO DG MARKS, LABELS, OR SHIPPING PAPERS DECLARING THE DISCOVERED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013.

item.title: Report E-2024120448
item.description:
Report E-2024120448

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 26, 2024, LGT notified ERTS of a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock in Garland, TX. The spill consisted of approximately half a quart of UN1824 Trupower All Purpose Dishmachine Detergent, which spilled from a box containing a 5-gallon plastic jug. The jug was damaged due to the shipper loading the box containing the jug too closely to another pallet, which punctured the container and caused it to leak out onto the trailer floor and on the dock as well. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who turned down contractor assistance. Terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On December 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3214 had faulty packaging during shipping and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all product from the trailer. All impacted waste and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: On 12/18/2024, at approximately 1400 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 19 fiberboard boxes, each presumably containing 4 glass bottles. One of boxes appeared to have been damaged, showing wet spots on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that 2 of the 4 bottles in the package were broken, resulting in spillage. The cause is the damage is unknown. The remaining 18 packages were moved forward in transit and the damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and hazardous disposal.

  • Description: ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XKC) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift accident, a 55-gallon poly drum was knocked over and released approximately 2 quarts of UN1903 ChemSan 1400. XPO stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #103. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who turned down contractor assistance. Terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release. The drum was up-righted and the lid of the drum was re-secured for the drums continued shipmen on. The impacted absorbents used to clean the spill were containerized into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1751 ET, Drew Rechenmacher with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BIN. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1050 Hydrogen Cloride released from cylinder due to lose valve. The release impacted trailer # 3191604. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The Contractor tested the air in the trailer with an air meter, colorimetric (Draeger) detection tubes, and a series of pH strips in various sections of the trailer. No waste was generated.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0651 ET, XPO-XCL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Ammonium Hydrogendifluoride released from a plastic bag due to the bag ripping from underneath the pallet. The release impacted the concrete dock. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5lb release onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of dunnage. The contract used a HEPA Vac to clean-up the release. The spill product, overpacked damaged bag, impacted PPE, and HEPA Vac filter were containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated by the incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil was involved in this incident.
